    Package Introduction

    introduction.Rmd

    In this vignette, you will learn about the scope of beastt() and where to find additional information on how to implement your analysis in beastt().

    Introduction

    Bayesian Dynamic Borrowing (BDB) is a way to incorporate external control data to mitigate bias. BEASTT focused on implementing BDB, specifically focused on Robust Mixtures Priors.

    beastt has the following goals:

    • goal 1
    • goal 2
    • goal 3

    Common Usage

    Create Data Sets 

    library(beastt)
library(ggdist)
library(ggplot2)

set.seed(1234)

# Create internal and external datasets
internal_df <- data.frame(id_col = 1:20, cov1 = rnorm(10, 2), cov2 = rnorm(100, 20), 
                          y = rnorm(20, mean = 5, sd = 3)
external_df <- data.frame(id_col = 21:40, cov1 = rnorm(10, 2), cov2 = rnorm(100, 18), 
                          y = rnorm(20, mean = 8, sd = 4)
